alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 28 at 6:04AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF LOWER YAMPA RIVER BASIN...EASTERN UINTA BASIN...TAVAPUTS PLATEAU...AND EASTERN UINTA MOUNTAINS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which willrapidly reduce visibility to less than one half of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 603 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Vernal to 14 miles southeast of Sunnyside and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Dinosaur around 650 AM MST. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 3. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 148 and 174. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau
